name: tap water production, conventional with biological treatment | tap water | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11058/documentation

This dataset is created as a child of global dataset with edited production volume, activity links and river/lake water exchanges ratio valid for this geography. ;;This dataset represents production of 1 kg of tap water under pressure at facility gate, ready for distribution in network. It represents average operation of conventional with biological filtration treatment for production of tap water. Conventional with biological filtration treatment includes coagulation and decantation, biological filtration and disinfection. Other treatment such as oxidation (ultraviolet radiation, ozone) and other adjustment (pH, alkalinity, etc.)  can be present in some plant. Inventory was constructed from reported chemicals, energy inputs and wastes from 2 distinct conventional with biological filtration plants located in Québec.;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - tap water production and supply, CH, 2000 - 2000 (3a700e71-708f-4021-873e-0a20b29460ad)]

From the intake pumping of raw surface water into the water treatment plant. 

This dataset ends with the production of tap water, at facility gate, under pressure. It includes energy for intake pumping, treatment system, lighting and heating of the building as well as the energy of the pump pressurizing water to the beginning of the network. It includes all chemicals and material added to the water during treatment and, when needed, ultraviolent lamps for replacement. It excludes energy for pumping stations and water losses within the network which is included in the tap water market. Emissions to the environment occurring during the treatment and during the distribution were not considered as they are assumed negligible. Main substance in water that would be released in the environment are assumed to be considered in wastewater processes.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/36:Water collection, treatment and supply/360:Water collection, treatment and supply/3600:Water collection, treatment and supply

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Extrapolated from data from two plants in Quebec (Canada). The uncertainty was adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Most frequent technology in tap water production facility in Quebec
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: From two conventional tap water production facilities with biological treatment in Quebec to global average of same technology. The uncertainty has been changed accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Based on data collected from two conventional treatment plants in  Quebec (Canada). See corresponding Quebec dataset for more information. Note that percent representativeness is not supplied because technology-specific global production volumes is too uncertain. Should this information become available, the representativeness can be calculated by dividing the sum of the water treated by the Quebec plants that served as a basis for the Global dataset by the technology-specific global production volume. (2.31E10 kg/a)

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. 

The shares between technologies and water sources are calculated based on literature data (http://www.svgw.ch/fileadmin/resources/svgw/web/Shop-Boutique/download/09_W-Informationsmaterial/SVGW_Shop_TWI-12_d.pdf ) and estimates.

40% of water used for production of tap water in Switzerland comes from surface waters (other than lake)
20% of water used for production of tap water in Switzerland comes from lake water
40% of water used for production of tap water in Switzerland comes from ground water

28% of tap water is treated by conventional treatment
32% of tap water is treated by direct filtration
40% of tap water is nit treated or the treatment is very basic

0.0326 kg is the amount of water lost during the process
